name: Bard
description: An inspiring magician whose power echoes the music of creation.

level_1_features.name: Spellcasting
level_1_features.description: You have learned to cast spells through your bardic performance.

level_1_features.name: Bardic Inspiration
level_1_features.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have learned to cast spells through your bardic performance. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your bard spells.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

features.name: Jack of All Trades
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Song of Rest
features.description: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points.

features.name: Bard College
features.description: At 3rd level, you delve into the advanced techniques of a bard college of your choice. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th and 14th level.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: At 3rd level, choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration (d8)
features.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d8.

features.name: Font of Inspiration
features.description: Beginning when you reach 5th level, you regain all of your expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

features.name: Bard College Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Bard College.

features.name: Countercharm
features.description: At 6th level, you gain the ability to use musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, you can start a performance that lasts until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and any friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Song of Rest (d8)
features.description: Your Song of Rest healing die improves to d8.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration (d10)
features.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d10.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: At 10th level, you can choose two more of your skill proficiencies to gain the benefit of Expertise.

features.name: Magical Secrets
features.description: By 10th level, you have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines. Choose two spells from any classes, including this one. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as bard spells for you and are included in the Spells Known column of the Bard table.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Song of Rest (d10)
features.description: Your Song of Rest healing die improves to d10.

features.name: Magical Secrets
features.description: You learn two additional spells from any class.

features.name: Bard College Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Bard College.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration (d12)
features.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d12.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Song of Rest (d12)
features.description: Your Song of Rest healing die improves to d12.

features.name: Magical Secrets
features.description: You learn two additional spells from any class.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Superior Inspiration
features.description: At 20th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use.
